Pay is extremely inequitable and downright not morally fair when paying someone $20k more than another doing the same job when the other has higher qualifications. Yikes.

job_title: Registered Nurse in New Bedford, MA
pros: The people. I've never met a better group of hard working and resilient people.
cons: When I first started three years ago as a medsurg nurse the floors were staffed with aids, hucs (secretaries) and a unit assistant (for the odd and end jobs) which helped the role of the nurse immensely. Recently (for over one year) staffing has been poor and nurses are expected to uphold excellent customer service, with a five plus patient assignment, all the while with one, maybe two, aids on the 35+ patient floor. Day shift we are responsible for the complete care of the patients-washing up, ambulating three times a day, toileting, etc.-all the while having little to no help from aids as they're overworked too. We've had our wages frozen going on two years now, all while Southcoast maintains this facade that they're hurting for money (yet 2014 was one of their most profitable yet!). I recently transferred from one understaffed department to a more short staffed department (unkowningly) in hopes it might be different, and now am told I am not allowed to use the full extent of my vacation hours (which are accumulated in my "earned time off bank") because "we're understaffed, and there's no one to cover your vacation"

job_title: Administrative Assistant in Fairhaven, MA

Great Staff

job_title: Registered Nurse in Plymouth, MA
pros: Good for experience as a new nurse

job_title: MIS Group in New Bedford, MA
pros: They pay well and the benefits are decent. I worked within a large group of techs and everyone got along well.
cons: You usually need to know someone who work within the company to get a job here. Its hard to move up from a entry level position. The communication is horrible between the groups. The left hand has either no idea or doesn't care what the right hand is doing. They keep poor managers. Especially if the manager know someone in a higher level position. They fire good managers. Some of the women managers seem to only want to hire women. The health insurance only pays full coverage when you go to a Southcoast hospital facility. This can be embarrassing depending on the procedure you are having done. They will tell you people wont recognize you or they dont gossip, but this is not true.

review_title: Southcoast casts a blind eye to nurse on nurse bullying.
job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Westport, MA
pros: Lots of open positions within the organization.
cons: Lowest wages in the area, bullying is tolerated. From management to HR Southcoast will blatantly  cast a blind eye to nurse on nurse bullying rather than acknowledge it exists. SPG offices are reminiscent of high school cliques. The staff is small and and if you start off on the wrong foot with an over worked and underpaid senior nurse who feels she doesn't have the time or patience to train you... Good luck getting the adequate training that you need for success. First went to the manager on site for help and only after that deemed not to help then went to HR. Both pretended their wasn't an issue with my senior nurse bullying me. Reality is if your bullied by the senior nurse on site that the medical assistants, physicians, and most definitely the manager in the office will follow suit since they relay heavily on that nurse within the practice. Most victims of bullying rarely speak up because the truth is even if you do speak up you then get labeled the issue. Group mentality is no one wants to be the next target. Its easier to go with the group then against.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in New Bedford, MA
pros: Great co-workers and providers. Culturally diverse patient population. Local hospital, very busy environement, fast-paced, day goes by quickly. Compensation and benefits good.
cons:
Administrationis focused far to much on finances! It goes without saying that a fiscally-responsible approach to healthcare is necessary. However, this approach should not compromise or ignore the healthcare needs of those suffering from a chronic illness. Care is too fragmented. Focus on the entire patient is lacking which directly relates to this system's high rate of hospital readmissions. 
Also, pay has been frozen, benefits reduced while employee costs have increase d. Moral is very poor.

review_title: needs to have stronger leadership and direction with a planned strategy for success
job_title: Middle Management in Fall River, MA
pros: Most of hands off staff are dedicated good workers.
cons: Use of many outside consultants for decisions and leadership.    Senior leadership decisions are very much top down with little participation from middle management or staff.    Some leaders in senior admin are weak.   Several layoffs in last few years,  wage freezes and declining benefits.   RN pay makes it difficult to recruit top of the line staff.  Medical benefits are within system and the administration of outpatient services is very lacking.  Takes many calls to make appts for routine health screenings.  Central scheduling is a nightmare; often takes weeks for appointments.

job_title: Medical Assistant in Warwick, RI
pros: It's a pay check every 2 weeks
cons: Horrible pay, work overload, don't value employees especially medical asst. MA's do the bulk of the work in office but we can get paid more being a cashier in a supermarket, no bonus, Christmas bonus you get a fattening Mrs.Field Cookie which some can't enjoy because of health issues

job_title: Labor&Delivery RN in New Bedford, MA
pros: I have worked here since I was a sophomore in college and have really learned a great deal and have built great relationships with the employees ai have worked with.
cons: Many employees, including myself are looking for employment elsewhere because so much has been taken away from staff that used to enrich our experience. It is no longer about making staff and patients happy...it is only about patient satisfaction, still very important either way.

job_title: Management in New Bedford, MA
pros: Fast paced work environment, progressive expansion of services. Mangement is open to ideas and will provide the resources to assist in meeting goals. Southcoast is one of the best places to be employed.
cons: A few growing pains, can be overwhelming to some. High expectations, and long hours to achieve system goals.  At the end the of the day Southcoast is a rewarding place to work.

review_title: If you like your job here, you are one of the few.
job_title: Human Resources in New Bedford, MA
pros: Colleagues are supportive.
cons:
The environment is chaotic.  The department is severely under resourced and there is very little focus on or investment in professional development.  There is a great deal of animosity between locations and teams, and the expectations of what one role is supposed to carry is completely unrealistic.   My reviews were delivered as if it was an afterthought, with no real direction as to where i was excelling or where i could improve.   There is also no opportunity for advancement.  It is clear that Southcoast would rather hire from outside than promote internally.

The pay is on the low side of the spectrum, but the deplorable benefits package really adds insult to injury.

review_title: Has become very cold and corporate

review_title: Health Care System Providing Excellent Care and Services Locally
job_title: Vice President in New Bedford, MA
pros: Innovative health care system that dedicated to providing a wide scope of highly technical services to a region.
cons: Significant fluctuations or changes in State or Federal payments can cause unanticipated cutbacks in operations or services.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in New Bedford, MA
pros: Lots of friendly, capable employees.
cons: Very top driven organization, initiatives all come from the top, staff is seldom heard.  Leadership is self-serving and removed from day to day operations.

job_title: RN Case Manager in Fairhaven, MA
pros: independence and autonomy in role, flexible schedule, no on call
cons: high turn over with management which limits direction and resource needs, pay is less than average

job_title: Radiology Transcriptionist/Receptionist in Fall River, MA
pros: The benefits were excellent.  Also the manager in charge of my section and the doctors were personable and accessible.
cons: There were a lot of weekends and evenings that needed to be covered.

job_title: Operations in Dartmouth, MA
pros: Exposed to a diverse group of coworkers as well as patients. Always opportunities for growth.
cons: The constant shakeup of leadership. Staff can find themselves in "cliques" dependent upon which department they find themselves in.

job_title: Medical Records in Fairhaven, MA
pros: Its a great company to work for.
cons: The management needs to learn how to communicate correctly to employees and not embarrass them in front of people when its not necessary.

job_title: Software Development Programmer in Fairhaven, MA
pros: Lots of freedom to express your thoughts and opinions. Great people to work with.
cons: None as of right now.

job_title: in Fairhaven, MA
pros: great salary and benefits. great commute and hours. great culture and atmosphere.
cons: none yet, and I don't expect that to change.

job_title: Laboratory Assistant in Fall River, MA
pros: Insurance is good as long as you use Southcoast physicians.
cons: So short staffed. Employees are worn too thin. Very stressful. Low pay.

job_title: Imaging Assistant in Fall River, WI
pros: Meeting different people and interacting with different staff
cons: Learning new tasks and you can move up in the company

job_title: Supervisor in Fall River, MA
pros: Dedicated, hard-working individuals across all departments and levels
cons: Trend seems to be asking more and more of staff

job_title: Registered Dietitian in Fall River, MA
pros: Earned time carries over year to year.  Tuition reimbursement. Academy and CDR dues are reimbursed.
cons: CNM is not available often.  Fair turnover rate at one of our hospitals.

job_title: Specialist in Fairhaven, MA
pros: Awesome group of people to work with. Friendly co-workers.
cons: none that I can think of....except closer bathrooms would be nice.

job_title: Nurse Practitioner in New Bedford, MA
pros: Good working environment and team.
cons: Poor pay.  Southcoast doesn't really get what NPs do

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Fairhaven, MA
pros: A great company to work for. I look forward to coming to work everyday.
cons: No cons to report at this time.

job_title: ERP Functional Consultant in Fairhaven, MA
pros: Excellent team culture and great coworkers. Southcoast offers a very good work/life balance.
cons: No major cons so far.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in New Bedford, MA
pros: Great environment that promotes team collaboration and hiring and promoting from within the organization! Also, best hospital food :)
cons: Not applicable at this time.

job_title: REGISTERED NURSE, MEDICAL-SURGICAL in Fall River, MA
pros: There are great benefits and opportunities for advancement.
cons: Many changes, there may be a lack of support for employees at times.

job_title: ER Technician in Fall River, MA
pros: Management was great, everything was smooth. Great hospital to work for.
cons: I didnt have a negative experience working there.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Fall River, MA
pros: Great place to learn for a new nurse, everyone is nice
cons: Pay and working every weekend either Friday and Saturday or Sunday’s

job_title: Staff Nurse in New Bedford, MA
pros: Somewhat flexible schedule, decent pay and incentives. Offers insurance
cons: Staff are clique, management in some areas are inept, insurance expensive. Orientation cut short

job_title: Support Services in Fall River, MA
pros: Good coworkers, that's about it
cons: Compensation and benefits are terrible and get worse every year, 2017 comp and benefits letter just came out and it's yet another year of take aways!!!

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Fairhaven, MA
pros: Great co workers , good hours
cons: John Days retirement was a sad day for sc healthcare

job_title: Therepeutic Assistant in Fall River, MA
pros: Relaxed Environment, Great staff, decent hours
cons:
-Pay was a little low
-when low on staff you are responsible to pick up slack

job_title: Interim Team Leader in Fall River, MA
pros: Decent pay and work hours; most coworkers pleasant; cafeteria onsite is convenient.
cons: Not financially stable; upper management support can be fickle.

job_title: Clinical Nurse Educator in Fall River, MA
pros: Progressive Community Hospital with great cardiac programs

job_title: CNA/HHA in Fairhaven, MA

cons: Pay is not good and lack of hours.

job_title: Medical Transcriptionist/Editor in Fall River, MA

job_title: Coder in Fall River, MA

job_title: Pharmacy Technician in Wareham, MA

job_title: Anonymous Employee in New Bedford, MA

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Fall River, MA

job_title: Registered Nurse in Fall River, MA
